title: Experts call for a measles 'immunization action plan' in Ontario
desc: The province last year experienced its largest measles outbreak in nearly three decades and Canada lost measles elimination status.

title: Revealed: When Ted Lasso Season 4 will be released as Jason Sudeikis' beloved coach returns to AFC Richmond
desc: A vague 2026 release date for the long-awaited season four of the hit TV show Ted Lasso has been revealed. Ted Lasso first aired in August 2020 and has become a much-loved programme, going on to span three seasons. And while the show was expected to end following the last episode of series three in May 2023, the finale left fans wishing for more from the AFC Richmond coach.

title: Staff at leading Irish insurance underwriter say they've been left without pay as firm enters liquidation
desc: “People are desperately trying to find jobs at the moment, but it is very difficult,” one former employee said.

title: Brandon Sanderson's Mistborn, Stormlight Archive to Get Movie, TV Show
desc: Brandon Sanderson's 'Mistborn' series and 'The Stormlight Archive' are being eyed for film and television adaptation at Apple.

title: Marc Anthony, Nadia Ferreira are expecting their second baby
desc: Marc Anthony and Nadia Ferreira revealed in a joint Instagram post that they are expecting their second child together. The baby will be Grammy winner Anthony's eighth.

title: Assisted dying bill 'no hope' of passing unless Lords change approach, warns peer
desc: Lord Falconer said the bill has "absolutely no hope" of passing without a "fundamental change" in approach.

title: Universal basic income needed to cushion blow from AI job losses says UK minister
desc: Lord Jason Stockwood had previously suggested that tech companies could pay a windfall levy to fund the payments

title: These two viruses may become the next public health threats, scientists say
desc: Two emerging pathogens with animal origins—influenza D virus and canine coronavirus—have so far been quietly flying under the radar, but researchers warn conditions are ripe for the viruses to spread more widely among humans. If surveillance and diagnostics continue to lag, influenza D virus and canine coronavirus have real potential to trigger outbreaks, writes a team of infectious disease experts and authors.
